verses.verse: And David<WH1732> consulted<WH3289> with the captains<WH8269> of thousands<WH505> and of hundreds<WH3967>, even with every leader<WH5057>.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> unto all the assembly<WH6951> of Israel<WH3478>, If it seem good<WH2895> unto you<WH3068>, and if it be of Jehovah our God<WH430>, let us send<WH7971> abroad<WH6555> every where unto our brethren<WH251> that are left<WH7604> in all the land<WH776> of Israel<WH3478>, with whom the priests<WH3548> and Levites<WH3881> are in their cities<WH5892> that have suburbs<WH4054>, that they may gather themselves unto us<WH6908>;
and let us bring again<WH5437> the ark<WH727> of our God<WH430> to us<WH1875>: for we sought not unto it in the days<WH3117> of Saul<WH7586>.
And all the assembly<WH6951> said<WH559> that they would do so<WH6213>; for the thing<WH1697> was right<WH3474> in the eyes<WH5869> of all the people<WH5971>.

So David<WH1732> assembled<WH6950> all Israel<WH3478> together<WH6950>, from the Shihor<WH7883> the brook of Egypt<WH4714> even unto the entrance<WH935> of Hamath<WH2574>, to bring<WH935> the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> from Kiriath-jearim<WH7157>.

And David<WH1732> went up<WH5927>, and all Israel<WH3478>, to Baalah<WH1173>, that is<WH7157>, to Kiriath-jearim, which belonged to Judah<WH3063>, to bring up<WH5927> from thence the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> Jehovah<WH3068> that sitteth<WH3427> above the cherubim<WH3742>, that is called<WH7121> by the Name<WH8034>.

And they carried<WH7392> the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> upon a new<WH2319> cart<WH5699>, and brought it out of the house<WH1004> of Abinadab<WH41>: and Uzza<WH5798> and Ahio<WH283> drove<WH5090> the cart<WH5699>.

And David<WH1732> and all Israel<WH3478> played<WH7832> before<WH6440> God<WH430> with all their might<WH5797>, even with songs<WH7892>, and with harps<WH3658>, and with psalteries<WH5035>, and with timbrels<WH8596>, and with cymbals<WH4700>, and with trumpets<WH2689>.
And when they came<WH935> unto the threshing-floor<WH1637> of Chidon<WH3592>, Uzza<WH5798> put forth<WH7971> his hand<WH3027> to hold<WH270> the ark<WH727>; for the oxen<WH1241> stumbled<WH8058>.

And the anger<WH639> of Jehovah<WH3068> was kindled<WH2734> against Uzza<WH5798>, and he smote<WH5221> him<WH7971>, because he put forth his hand<WH3027> to the ark<WH727>; and there he died<WH4191> before<WH6440> God<WH430>.

And David<WH1732> was displeased<WH2734>, because Jehovah<WH3068> had broken<WH6556> forth<WH6555> upon Uzza<WH5798>; and he called<WH7121> that place<WH4725> Perez-uzza<WH6560>, unto this day<WH3117>.
And David<WH1732> was afraid<WH3372> of God<WH430> that day<WH3117>, saying<WH559>, How<WH1963> shall I bring<WH935> the ark<WH727> of God home to me<WH430>?
So David<WH1732> removed<WH5493> not the ark<WH727> unto him into the city<WH5892> of David<WH1732>, but carried it aside<WH5186> into the house<WH1004> of Obed-edom<WH5654> the Gittite<WH1663>.

And the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> remained<WH3427> with the family<WH1004> of Obed-edom<WH5654> in his house<WH1004> three<WH7969> months<WH2320>: and Jehovah<WH3068> blessed<WH1288> the house<WH1004> of Obed-edom<WH5654>, and all that he had.
